column5: Here's to safe traveling and great fishing for everyone who's packed and ready to leave today for opening week in Ontario. Hope the ice is off your destination lake, the wait at the border crossing is short, and the fish are ravishingly hungry! Above all, come home with a smile on your face, blood pressure fifteen points lower, and a renewed appreciation for good friends, welcoming hosts, and the great outdoors.I'll be right behind you Monday for five solo days then the annual week with the crew of six. . . . year 35, trip 50 or so.

Yup, at this time before my trip I do worry about the travel portion. I got 880 miles from Denver to Devils Lake, we will fish a day with Matt Taylor on Devils then another 320 miles to Ft Francis. Plan to pull the entire 1200 in one long drive home. So if ya see a green Navigator with 4 guys smokin cigars, loaded to the gills with gear and with Walleye Central stickers on the back, rippin up the highway headin north..................... Well, that would probably be me. I also wish safe travels and good fishing for everyone!
Safe traveling to all. Remember to wear those Life Jackets and be careful on the water. May all your Landing nets be to SMALL. Mike Kansas
Slowing down saves lives and money. Enjoy your trips north. We leave Thursday and turn a 7 hour drive into 8 hours.
Ya, Hot Runner Guy's Walleye Central sticker is now a must have item on my Canadian fishing list. Don't leave home without it.
